body_html:
When you do things within a name scope context, all ops inside that scope have the name-scope string associated with their op names. you can change your code from: with ops.name_scope(...) as name: .... to just: with ops.name_scope(...): .... since you don't need the "name" variable.
…
On Thu, Apr 27, 2017 at 12:51 PM, Androbin ***@***.***> wrote: *@Androbin* commented on this pull request. ------------------------------ In tensorflow/contrib/signal/python/ops/shape_ops.py <#9236 (comment)> : > + pad_signal = array_ops.pad( + signal, [[0, 0], [0, pad_length - signal_length]]) + + indices_frame = array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(frame_length), 0) + indices_frames = array_ops.tile(indices_frame, [num_frames, 1]) + + indices_step = array_ops.expand_dims( + math_ops.range(num_frames) * frame_step, 1) + indices_steps = array_ops.tile(indices_step, [1, frame_length]) + + indices = indices_frames + indices_steps + + # TODO(Androbin) remove `transpose` when `gather` gets `axis` support + pad_signal = array_ops.transpose(pad_signal) + frames = array_ops.gather(pad_signal, indices) + frames = array_ops.transpose(frames, perm=[2, 0, 1], name=name) I thought this should be attached to the final op? Should this be moved somewhere else? May the name_scope alias be omitted? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#9236 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim51RXzBtTXT4Z29aKOzMLDvFtqp5ks5r0PHRgaJpZM4M-XOE> .
body_text:
When you do things within a name scope context, all ops inside that scope
have the name-scope string associated with their op names.  you can change
your code from:

with ops.name_scope(...) as name:
   ....

to just:

with ops.name_scope(...):
  ....

since you don't need the "name" variable.
…
On Thu, Apr 27, 2017 at 12:51 PM, Androbin ***@***.***> wrote:
 *@Androbin* commented on this pull request.
 ------------------------------

 In tensorflow/contrib/signal/python/ops/shape_ops.py
 <#9236 (comment)>
 :

 > +    pad_signal = array_ops.pad(
 +        signal, [[0, 0], [0, pad_length - signal_length]])
 +
 +    indices_frame = array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(frame_length), 0)
 +    indices_frames = array_ops.tile(indices_frame, [num_frames, 1])
 +
 +    indices_step = array_ops.expand_dims(
 +        math_ops.range(num_frames) * frame_step, 1)
 +    indices_steps = array_ops.tile(indices_step, [1, frame_length])
 +
 +    indices = indices_frames + indices_steps
 +
 +    # TODO(Androbin) remove `transpose` when `gather` gets `axis` support
 +    pad_signal = array_ops.transpose(pad_signal)
 +    frames = array_ops.gather(pad_signal, indices)
 +    frames = array_ops.transpose(frames, perm=[2, 0, 1], name=name)

 I thought this should be attached to the final op? Should this be moved
 somewhere else? May the name_scope alias be omitted?

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

body:
When you do things within a name scope context, all ops inside that scope
have the name-scope string associated with their op names.  you can change
your code from:

with ops.name_scope(...) as name:
   ....

to just:

with ops.name_scope(...):
  ....

since you don't need the "name" variable.

> +        signal, [[0, 0], [0, pad_length - signal_length]])
> +
> +    indices_frame = array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(frame_length), 0)
> +    indices_frames = array_ops.tile(indices_frame, [num_frames, 1])
> +
> +    indices_step = array_ops.expand_dims(
> +        math_ops.range(num_frames) * frame_step, 1)
> +    indices_steps = array_ops.tile(indices_step, [1, frame_length])
> +
> +    indices = indices_frames + indices_steps
> +
> +    # TODO(Androbin) remove `transpose` when `gather` gets `axis` support
> +    pad_signal = array_ops.transpose(pad_signal)
> +    frames = array_ops.gather(pad_signal, indices)
> +    frames = array_ops.transpose(frames, perm=[2, 0, 1], name=name)
>
> I thought this should be attached to the final op? Should this be moved
> somewhere else? May the name_scope alias be omitted?
>
